title: Great British Drives: Audi e-tron in the long-lost county of Westmorland
text:
The place where I first holidayed no longer exists. This was the county of Westmorland, which vanished in 1974 when Cumbria ate it, thanks to boundary changes. My mother and her sisters, who were born there, were outraged.

As children I and my cousins Judith and her brother Stephen had many holidays in and around the arrestingly beautiful Mallerstang Valley, sometimes camping with our parents, who had endless older relatives to see in the pretty market town of Kirkby Stephen and some of its surrounding villages.

They’re no longer with us, and it’s been decades since my cousins and I had been to Westmorland together, so we decided to re-visit and explore. During the 1970s we’d arrive in the ratty...
description: The place where I first holidayed no longer exists.
